Context:
The Cook Apprenticeship program at George Brown College offers in-school training at two levels (H601 and H607). Level I focuses on fundamental culinary skills and management practices, while Level II develops advanced culinary skills and leadership abilities. Both levels include on-the-job training under the sponsorship of a registered employer for earning the official Red Seal certification as a cook from the Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development (MLITSD) in Ontario.

Required courses for the Cook Apprenticeship program include:
- H601 COOK APPRENTICESHIP – BASIC: HOSF 6161 (Sanitation, Safety and Equipment), HOSF 6143 (Basic Nutrition), HOSF 6123 (Business Development – Basic), HOSF 6124 (Kitchen Management – Basic), HOSF 6125 (Food Theory – Basic), HOSF 6126 (Culinary Techniques – Basic), and HOSF 6127 (Bake Theory).
- H607 COOK APPRENTICESHIP – ADVANCED: HOSF 6133 (Business).

Graduates of the Cook Apprenticeship program can pursue careers in various industries such as restaurants, hotel dining rooms, cafés, hospitals, clubs and resorts, spas, and catering companies.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Cook Apprentice Program H601 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Offered:
- HOSF 6133: Business Development – Advanced
- HOSF 6134: Kitchen Management – Advanced
- HOSF 6135: Food Theory – Advanced
- HOSF 6136: Culinary Techniques – Advanced
- HOSF 6138: Techniques of Baking – Advanced

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $678.00 (Classroom fee) for one level of the program starting in Fall 2022
- Additional Costs:
  - Uniform: $290
  - Knives and small wares: $500–$700
  - Books: $400–$600
  - Black safety shoes: $110–$160
- Financial Assistance: Not eligible for OSAP funding
- Admission Requirements: Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, grade 12 English (C or U), grade 11 math (M or U) or grade 12 (C or U), registered as an apprentice with the Ontario Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development (MLITSD) and have a registered employer sponsor. Mature Student status (19 years of age or older).
- Course Exemptions: Certain Ontario Academic Credit (OAC), college or university credits may qualify for course exemptions. Many courses are also eligible for prior learning assessment.
- Health Policy: Students should be aware that various allergens, including nuts, dairy and shellfish, are routinely used in practical labs. George Brown College is sensitive to religious observances, but products purchased for production and consumption may not meet specific dietary laws related to halal and kosher foods.
- Disclaimer: Information contained on the website is subject to change without notice. Students should verify fee requirements with George Brown College.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Cook Apprentice Program H601 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
To apply for the Cook Apprentice Program (H601) at George Brown College, applicants must:
- Be registered as a cook apprentice with the Ontario Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development (MLITSD)
- Have a registered employer sponsor
- Have at least one year of industry experience
- Have an Ontario Secondary School Diploma with credits at or above the general level, or qualify for mature student status

For admission requirements and fees, applicants should contact their local Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development office. The contact information is:
14th Floor, 400 University Avenue, Toronto, Ontario M7A 1T7
General inquiry: 416-326-7600

For general Chef School inquiries, applicants can contact CHCAStudentSupport@georgebrown.ca. The George Brown College Contact Centre number is 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002.

The text also mentions several other programs offered by George Brown College: Culinary Skills (H134), Culinary Management (H100), and Baker / Patissier Apprentice Program (H600). Interested applicants can visit the website to learn more about these programs, book a campus tour, or sign up for an info session.

Applicants can also sign up to receive tailored resources to help with their application process. To do this, they need to provide their first name, last name, email address, and indicate whether they are a domestic or international student, along with their country of residence. They must also agree to receive email communications from George Brown College.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Cook Apprentice Program H601 | George Brown College2023.txt
